thread.title: Choose to Change Gun Laws

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Choose to Change Gun Laws
text:
Change: [CHƒÅnj]
verb
1. make or become different.
We've got to do something.
We simply can't continue to let people among us kill at this rate. Something has to happen. We don't even get the same feeling anymore. And that's what's scary. The shock has worn off. Desensitization has settled in. Another day in the neighborhood and another mass shooting seizes another community. This time at a college in Roseburg, Oregon.
Shootings in Rochester have spiked this year. Mass shootings have skyrocketed all over the nation.
I'd like to echo Obama's wise words last night, "This is a political choice that we make, to allow this to happen every few months in America. We collectively are answerable to those families who lose their loved ones."
Every time we shrug our shoulders and chalk these mass shootings up to just a new normal, every time we let our politicians vote down another protection act or disallow them to tweak our current gun laws, we are saying that we just don't want to choose to become something different.
UCC Roseburg, Oregon
